newsitem.title: BELGIUM: Highlights of Thursday's Commission briefing. [CORRECTED 12:28 GMT]
newsitem.headline: Highlights of Thursday's Commission briefing. [CORRECTED 12:28 GMT]

text.p: Following are highlights of the midday briefing by the European Commission on Thursday:

Spokesman Willy Helin dismissed French news reports implying that French Finance Minister Jean Arthuis had written to Commissioner Karel Van Miert in order to modify the rescue plan for Credit Lyonnais approved by the Commission on July 26, 1995 (corrects by inserting dropped reference to Credit Lyonnais).

Helin confirmed Arthuis's letter to Van Miert but said it had never been question of a new rescue plan. The letter was in reply to one sent by Van Miert, in which the Commission was asking for technical details on the rescue plan adopted the year before.

Asked about the financial future of the European Coal and Steel Community (ECSC), spokesman Nikolaus van der Pas said the Commission had discussed the statute of the ECSC loans on Wednesday. The outcome of the discussions was that the loans should continue to benefit from the Triplar statute. He also said that the Union should foresee a guarantee line to ensure this statute. Those questions would be further discussed between member states, he added.
Van der Pas reminded reporters that a news conference on the conservation of Brazilian tropical forests pilot programme would be held at 1600/1400 GMT in the press room.
